content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

I would choose strategy R {R}. This strategy is based on the concept of tit-for-tat, which is a popular strategy in repeated games. In this game, choosing R ensures that if my partner chooses B, I will lose 5$ but they gain 40$. However, if we both play R, we both earn 45$ each round. Since the game has 75 rounds and a potential loss of 5$ in one round seems insignificant compared to the potential gains over multiple rounds, I would choose strategy R as it fosters cooperation with my partner. However, this decision assumes that my partner will also play fairly and not exploit the situation by consistently choosing B.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

I would choose strategy B {B}. In this round, my opponent chose B, and they earned 40$, while I earned nothing. However, if I consistently play R and my opponent continues to play B, they will earn 320$ over the course of 75 rounds, while I will earn only 300$. To maximize my earnings, I would switch my strategy to B in this round to match my opponent's choice. This adjustment in strategy is called responding adaptively and allows me to ensure that I do not consistently lose out on earnings.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

I would choose strategy R {R}. In this round, my opponent chose R while I chose B, so I earned 40$ and my opponent earned nothing. If we both continue playing in this manner, I will earn 280$ over 75 rounds, while my opponent will earn only 300$. To maximize my earnings and potentially increase the chances of earning more if my opponent decides to adapt their strategy later on, I would choose R again in this round. This choice keeps open the possibility for future cooperation and higher payoffs if my opponent adjusts their strategy accordingly.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

However, if we both continue playing in this manner, I will earn a total of 150$ over 75 rounds, while my opponent will earn 600$. Since the game is repeated, it is likely that my opponent may adapt their strategy later on to maximize their earnings. By consistently choosing R and offering the possibility for cooperation in future rounds, I may be able to encourage my opponent to switch strategies and earn higher payoffs in subsequent rounds. This choice keeps open the possibility for future cooperation and potential higher payoffs.

By maintaining cooperation and choosing R each round, we can ensure that neither of us misses out on earning potential in this game.
